alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Clay; Coosa; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:06PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Randolph, northern Tallapoosa, northwestern Chambers, east central Coosa and southeastern Clay Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 906 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hillabee Creek, or near Kellyton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Dadeville, Goodwater, Kellyton, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Wadley, Goldville, Hillabee Creek, Bradford, Northern Lake Martin, Abanda, Crewsville, Sparkling Springs, Eastern Lake Martin, Daviston, Horseshoe Bend National Military Park, Hackneyville, Eagle Creek and Horseshoe Bend. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
